page.title: 06INDUSTRY-WEST NOTTINGHAM
page.content: In a survey of Yellow Pages of our area covering approximately 2,500 sq.km. we discovered that almost half of all dyers, bleachers and soap manufacturers, were situated in a two square kilometre block in the Basford area. This industry grew up along the Leen Valley especially in this area because of the availability of excellent water supplies. These are in the form of the River Leen itself and springs and wells cut deep into the {Bunter Sandstone}in which the water collects. The bleaching process also required large quantities of limestone which were in abundant supply locally. Other firms tend to specialize in dyeing certain articles in huge quantities. It is no accident either that Shipstone's{Brewery}is also situated nearby using the same water sources.
